definition: variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: I am a Chinese armed police soldiers, I was on duty.
sentences.chinese: 紧急啊我是一名中国武警战士，我正在值勤。

sentences.english: I questioned the duty captain about times and distances .
sentences.chinese: 我向海军部值勤官问了时间和距离。

sentences.english: Think how could the flatfoot on duty bear such a cold.
sentences.chinese: 想想那值勤的巡警怎么受得了这么冷的天。

sentences.english: I am a Chinese police soldier . I am on duty now .
sentences.chinese: 紧急啊我是一名中国武警战士，我正在值勤。

sentences.english: A policeman must not smoke while he is on duty.
sentences.chinese: 警察当班值勤时不得抽烟。

sentences.english: Two police officers have the class take turns on duty, a 24-hour inspections.
sentences.chinese: 干警们每班两人轮流值勤，实行24小时不间断巡查。

sentences.english: When traffic co- coordinators are on duty, follow their instructions.
sentences.chinese: 当有交通辅助员值勤时，请遵从他们的指示。

sentences.english: ' What's worse, there is a plague of air traffic controllers sleeping on the job.
sentences.chinese: 更糟的是，近来不少空管员是老鼠屎在值勤时睡著。

sentences.english: Early last year, the higher authority issued a mobile petrol car to them.
sentences.chinese: 去年年初，上级为连队配发了一台车载式移动值勤车。

sentences.english: Report an on duty brigade, these are our obligations.
sentences.chinese: 去报告值勤队，这是我们的义务。

sentences.english: There are many police out now.
sentences.chinese: 现在有许多警察在外面值勤。

definition: to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to stand guard/to serve on sentry duty
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
